Package org.eel.kitchen.jsonschema.report Description

Various utility packages

The one you will use the most often here is JsonLoader: it contains various methods to load JSON documents as JsonNode instances.

You may want to have a look at RhinoHelper, which is in charge of all regex validation: as the standard dictates ECMA 262 regexes, using java.util.regex is out of the question. See this class' description for more details.

The NodeType enum is a critical part of the code. Its ability to determine the type of a JsonNode is an essential part of the validation process.

Finally, the JacksonUtils class provides useful methods to perform common operations on exsting JsonNode instances.
